alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 22 at 12:13PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory today, southwest to west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch on Sunday, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 AM MDT Sunday. For the High Wind Watch, from Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected along east-facing slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains where mountain waves result in periodic and erratic gusts of 50 to 60 mph. Large trees that were severely burned during the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire will be especially susceptible to being blown down.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
